moves.1. e4: Another short game in this King's Gambit tournament. Analysis can be found at http://gameknot.com/analyze-board.pl?bd=19859834&fb=1
moves.2... exf4: I think this was the first game where I took the pawn and it worked out well for me
moves.3. Bc4 Nc6 4. Nf3 Bc5: The computer prefers Nf6 here but I wanted to hinder whites ability to castle
moves.5. d3: Computer calls this an inaccuracy preferring d4 which is what I was expecting.
moves.5... Qf6: This may seem premature but I didn't want to play g5 as it blocked my queens access to h4
moves.6. Nc3 Nge7: Preparing to castle. The knight can also be brought in to defend the f4 pawn if needed
moves.7. a3: The computer calls this an inaccuracy preferring 7. Na4 Be3 8. Bxe3 fxe3 9. Qe2 Rb8. Personally I can't see the real point of it.
moves.7... d6: opens the diagonal for my lsb to come to g4 pinning the white rook to the queen
moves.8. Bd2: The computer calls this an inaccuracy preferring 8. e5 Nxe5 9. Ne4 Qf5 10. Nh4 Qd7. I think white was feeling a little cramped here
moves.8... Bg4: If the white knight stays pinned I can threaten it with Nd4. I can get my queen in to h4 which I am hoping will cause big problems for white.
moves.9. Qe2: The computer calls this a blunder, at the time it helped me with my plan
moves.9... Nd4 10. Qd1:
Computer calls this a blunder preferring 10. e5 Qh6 11. Qe4 Nxc2+ 12. Ke2 Bxf3+

I was quite happy, my biggest problem was should I take the white knight with my knight or the bishop
moves.10... Nxf3+: I eventually went with the knight, note that the knight is immune to gxf3 as we will see
moves.11. gxf3:
Unfortunately for white he didn't see it and it's now mate in 2 -  11. gxf3 Qh4+ 12. Ke2 Qf2#

The computer prefers  11. Qxf3 Bxf3 12. gxf3 Qh4+ 13. Kd1 Qf2 14. Kc1 Qxf3 15. Rd1 Qf2 16. Nb5 Rc8 17. b4 Be3 18. Bxe3 Qxe3+
moves.11... Qh4+: Thanks for reading please comment and rate
